subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: what you hear is what you get
author: Zack Widup
full_text:
Yeah, what you hear is what you hear. What I hear is what I hear. If they're
different, no biggie to me.

Having spent hundreds of hours in a darkroom making fine-art prints, I see
things in photos that most people don't. That doesn't mean they aren't
there. And I never could figure out how those judges see all of that stuff
in figure skaters' performances that I don't see. But it doesn't upset me.
:-)

Zack

On Fri, May 15, 2009 at 11:43 AM, Frank Sumption
<purplealiengirl@...>wrote:

>
>
>   Soooo, everyone hears different, and personally I find it offensive when
> someone presumes to tell everyone what another researhcer's voices really
> say. I think EVP messages are for the one that recorded thmm, to everyone
> else it's non-sense, except there's enough to show that there is a
> phenomenon.
>
>  I get really tired of these self proclaimed experts trying to dicate
> what's acceptable.
>
>  Frank-S
>
>   On Fri, May 15, 2009 at 10:04 AM, Rick <rasterer@...> wrote:
>
>>
>>
>> I opened your folder and examined all your files.
>>
>> Here are my opinions (I have truncated the file names due to laziness):
>>
>> ahh_mmm noises, no speech
>> call_us noises, no speech
>> cal_us (enhanced) several listenings: pixelated, no speech
>> compare_panasonic noises, no speech
>> compare_sony noises, no speech
>> first_epv noises, no speech
>> good_whistle noises, no speech (maybe feedback)
>> hey_can noises, no speech
>> hey_whats noises, no speech
>> I_hit noises, no speech
>> important_date noises, no speech
>> keep_moving several listenings: Hellalal see woobeh
>> laugh_evp noises, no speech
>> lets_wait several listenings: noises, no speech
>> maybe_gun noises, no speech
>> miss_you noises, no speech
>> my_question several listenings: no da lee
>> oh_ noises, no speech
>> something several listenings: noises, no speech
>> that_mans noises, no speech
>> that's_jim noises, no speech
>> this_one several listenings: noises, no speech
>> tomorrow noises, no speech
>>
>> The ones that took several listenings I thought I might hear words in, so
>> I examined those several times. Sometimes I could sort of hear something
>> that sort of sounded like what you suggested, but I could also hear it in
>> other ways, or not at all.
>>
>> So my suggestion to you, if you want to get less subjective conjuctures or
>> simply less affirmations of your own interpretations, is to post the future
>> ones without labels. The labels you give can influence the listeners: when
>> you have a sound that could be several things, and you note that it sounded
>> like "keep it moving", the listener can find it nearly impossible to try NOT
>> to hear what you heard, and so not be able to give a fresh perspecive to
>> help your research methods.
>>
>> --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com <EVP-ITC%40yahoogroups.com>, "James W.
>> Hyslope" <clockdryve@...> wrote:
>> >
>> > Go to my Folder in the files section "Jim's RR-DR60 EVP's" and see if
>> anyone (needs to) decide "FOR ME" and let me know if I am of the serious
>> type. In my short time I have gathered enough "proof" for myself that this
>> method works for ME. And from what I have seen from others that I have let
>> "listen" to my files (friends) I am blessed with the "ability" to HEAR very
>> low audio artifacts....so this will help me in my RESEARCH. And I am OPEN to
>> any help to reach my goals (or help others) with their goals. Have fun
>> people. On a HAPPIER NOTE :) I was lucky enough to catch the RR-DR60 taking
>> a nap yesterday....it missed a few evp's real close together (in a 5 second
>> clip) the Sony ICD-B7 heard a male use a different number than what I used.
>> I said 16 (my earlier age I was saying in recorder) and the male evp said
>> 13....then a female laughs. All this was missed by the DR60 (except my 16
>> was recorded in both recorders) BUT then the DR60 "caught" the B7 "napping"
>> at near the end of the 5 second clip....the DR60 heard "let me out" in a
>> clear (quite) males voice. So this is very promising piece of evidence for
>> me. **those 2 recordings have been uploaded to my folder. I will include an
>> Olympus W-10 (soon as arrives), Panasonic RR-US360 (when I think to grab it)
>> and my RR-QR80 to go with my RR-QR100, and one more (can't remember what
>> brand-model of this last---due to arrive) LOL. I need to build a multiple
>> mounting devise to aid in putting these into tandem service. Then I think I
>> will use my Olympus DS-50 as my "Control" recorder....by using it on the HQ
>> settings. I am looking to build a "subsonic" microphone also (something to
>> do with those low "booms" that I have noticed lead or follow many evp's). So
>> I look forward to any ideas. Falure is NOT an option. Haha.....
>> >
>>
>>
>  
>

:-)
 
Zack
